page.title: 15Clifton Library
page.content: We interviewed Mrs Ibbotson one of the Librarians at Clifton Library. In the Library there are 18,500 books and every year about 90,000 books are borrowed. There are 3 librarians in charge of 8 local libraries including this one and the one at Clifton Hospital. The librarians work in teams. Our Library was built in 1969 when it formed part of the North Riding County Library. As well as adult and junior fiction and non-fiction there are reference books. There are special books for blind children, these have a raised pattern for the child to follow with its fingers. The library has books with large print for people with bad eye-sight. Many more borrowers are expected soon from the new housing estates close by on the airfield.
